item.title: 华尔街日报》称，边疆航空谈判失败，精神航空将面临破产
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》报道，在与边疆集团控股公司（Frontier Group Holdings Inc.【原文：Spirit Airlines Inc. is preparing to file for bankruptcy protection after merger talks with Frontier Group Holdings Inc. broke down, the Wall Street Journal reported.】

item.title: 压力增大，韩国锌业将就有争议的 18 亿美元股份计划做出决定
item.description: 韩国锌业公司（Korea Zinc Co.）董事会将于周三召开会议，决定是否继续执行一项价值 18 亿美元的股票出售计划。【原文：Korea Zinc Co.’s board will meet on Wednesday to decide whether or not to proceed with a $1.8 billion share sale plan which prompted a selloff in the stock and triggered an investigation by the country’s financial watchdog.】

item.title: 亚马逊将关闭由广告支持的流媒体电视服务 Freevee
item.description: 据知情人士透露，亚马逊公司正在关闭免费观看、广告支持的流媒体服务 Freevee，将其并入订阅型 Prime Video 产品。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is closing Freevee, the free-to-watch, advertising-supported streaming service, folding it into the subscription-based Prime Video product, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美国通胀前债券下跌，利率押注暂缓：市场综述
item.description: 在可能进一步削弱对美联储降息步伐信心的关键通胀数据公布之前，国债收益率攀升，美元汇率创下两年新高。在美国股市强劲反弹后，亚洲股市将低开。【原文：Treasury yields climbed and the dollar hit a two-year high ahead of key inflation data that could further sap confidence in the pace of Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts. Stocks in Asia are set to open lower after a breakneck US rally ran out of steam.】

item.title: 合作社负责人称，特朗普的大规模驱逐计划将损害农业发展
item.description: 当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁要进行大规模驱逐，这有可能伤害到已经在劳动力短缺问题上苦苦挣扎的国内农业部门。【原文：President-Elect Donald Trump’s threat of mass deportations risks hurting the domestic agriculture sector already struggling with labor shortages.】

item.title: 汽车融资公司 Vroom 计划申请破产保护以重组债务
item.description: 汽车融资服务提供商 Vroom 公司周二发表声明称，计划根据破产法第 11 章向美国破产法院提交预包装重组申请。【原文：Automotive financing provider Vroom, Inc. plans to file a prepackaged reorganization under Chapter 11 in US bankruptcy court, according to a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 巴西央行在雷亚尔下跌之际介入货币市场
item.description: 由于巴西国内的财政问题和全球风险资产的普遍下滑，雷亚尔受到重创，巴西央行正在介入货币市场。【原文：Brazil’s central bank is stepping into currency markets as the real has been battered by fiscal concerns at home and a broad slide in risk assets globally.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）又有新项目了：特朗普政府
item.description:
在向当选总统的竞选活动投入了至少1.32亿美元之后，这位世界首富即将把美国政府当作一个亏损的社交网络来对待。【原文：

After plowing at least $132 million into the president-elect’s campaign, the richest man in the world is about to treat the US government as if it were a money-losing social network.

】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后交易员加大国债抛售押注
item.description: 由于预计唐纳德-特朗普承诺的政策将重燃通胀，并使美国利率居高不下，交易员们正加码押注国债市场将进一步下跌。【原文：Traders are loading up on bets for further losses in the Treasury market in anticipation that Donald Trump’s pledged policies will rekindle inflation and keep US interest rates high.】

item.title: 凯尔-巴斯称赞特朗普的中国鹰派是应对习近平威胁的 "现实主义者
item.description: 对冲基金资深人士凯尔.巴斯（Kyle Bass）对当选总统唐纳德.特朗普内阁有望任命具有强烈反华观点的官员表示欢迎，尽管这有可能使世界最大经济体之间的关系趋于紧张。【原文：The expected appointment of officials with strong anti-China views to President-elect Donald Trump’s cabinet was welcomed by hedge fund veteran Kyle Bass, even as it risks straining ties between the world’s largest economies.】

item.title: 大众 8 亿美元押注 Rivian 电动汽车技术
item.description: 大众汽车公司（Volkswagen AG）和 Rivian Automotive 公司任命了其价值数十亿美元的合资企业的领导人，并展示了一辆电动汽车原型，这表明了他们的承诺，即使在全球电动汽车需求疲软、即将上任的特朗普政府威胁要削减扶持政策的情况下也是如此。【原文：Volkswagen AG and Rivian Automotive Inc. named leaders for their multibillion-dollar joint venture and showcased a prototype electric vehicle, signaling their commitment even as global EV demand softens and the incoming Trump administration threatens to curtail supportive policies.】

item.title: FanDuel 所有者 Flutter 超出销售预期，但对前景持谨慎态度
item.description: 美国体育博彩巨头 FanDuel 的运营商 Flutter Entertainment 公布的第三季度销售额超过了分析师的预期，但该公司警告称，第四季度的开局将十分艰难。【原文：Flutter Entertainment, operator of US sports betting giant FanDuel, reported third-quarter sales that beat analysts’ estimates but warned of a tough start to the current fourth quarter.】

item.title: 广告销售下滑，Spotify 用户数和利润率仍超预期
item.description: Spotify 技术公司（Spotify Technology SA）报告称，第三季度用户数量和利润率均有所增长，并表示较低的营销和人事成本帮助该音乐流媒体服务克服了艰难的广告环境。【原文：Spotify Technology SA reported third-quarter growth in subscribers and profit margins, saying lower marketing and personnel costs helped the music streaming service overcome a tough climate for advertising.】

item.title: Stop &amp 遭到黑客攻击；店主将对 Instacart 的业绩进行评估
item.description: Instacart 周二表示，预计影响 Stop & Shop 和 Hannaford 所有者 Royal Ahold Delhaize NV 的网络安全事件将对该在线平台的第四季度前景产生 "轻微影响"。【原文：Instacart said Tuesday that it expects a cybersecurity incident affecting Stop & Shop and Hannaford owner Royal Ahold Delhaize NV to have a “small impact” on the online platform’s fourth-quarter outlook.】

item.title: 尽管杂货需求保持稳定，Instacart 前景喜忧参半
item.description: Instacart 公布的第三季度收入强劲，表明其核心杂货配送业务的恢复能力。不过，该公司对当期调整后收益的预测低于分析师的预期。【原文：Instacart posted strong revenue in the third quarter, a sign of resilience in its core grocery delivery business. However, it forecast adjusted earnings in the current period that fell short of analysts’ expectations.】

item.title: 苹果的下一款设备是人工智能墙平板电脑，用于家庭控制、Siri 和视频通话
item.description: 苹果公司为了在智能家居市场上赶超竞争对手，即将推出一个新的产品类别：一种可以控制电器、处理视频会议并利用人工智能导航应用程序的壁挂式显示器。【原文：Apple Inc., aiming to catch up with rivals in the smart home market, is nearing the launch of a new product category: a wall-mounted display that can control appliances, handle videoconferencing and use AI to navigate apps.】

item.title: OpenAI 联合创始人休假数月后重返创业公司
item.description: OpenAI 联合创始人格雷格-布罗克曼（Greg Brockman）在辞去总裁职务三个月后重返这家人工智能初创公司，在高管纷纷出走的情况下，这位关键人物重回公司 C 层。【原文：OpenAI co-founder Greg Brockman has returned to the artificial intelligence startup three months after taking a leave from his role as president, bringing a key figure back to the C-suite amid an exodus of top executives.】

item.title: Gildan 首次考虑在加拿大出售债务
item.description: 据了解此事的基金经理称，Gildan Activewear 公司正在考虑在加拿大首次出售债务，并已与固定收益投资者会面，讨论潜在的出售事宜。【原文：Gildan Activewear Inc. is looking at selling debt for the first time in Canada, and has set up meetings with fixed-income investors to discuss the potential sale, according to money managers briefed on the matter.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利称，只有通胀可能导致 12 月减息计划流产
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，他将关注即将公布的通胀数据，以确定在美国央行 12 月份的会议上再次降息是否合适。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said he’ll be looking at incoming inflation data to determine whether another interest-rate cut is appropriate at the US central bank’s December meeting.】

item.title: 巴菲特的伯克希尔公司被打包成杠杆 ETF
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）近 30 年前创立了伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：Warren Buffett created Berkshire Hathaway Inc.’s Class B shares almost 30 years ago to stymie money managers who sought to split the high-priced conglomerate’s stock.】

item.title: 美国公司在风险溢价骤降后抢滩债市
item.description: 周二，各路企业纷纷涌入债市，利用强劲的需求和相对有利的借贷成本。【原文：Companies of all stripes are diving into the debt market on Tuesday, taking advantage of robust demand and relatively favorable borrowing costs.】

item.title: 阿根廷月通胀率超预期降至 2.7
item.description: 阿根廷上个月的通胀放缓幅度超过预期，达到了三年来的最低水平，这让本已兴高采烈的哈维尔-米莱伊总统倍感振奋，他把重新控制通胀作为政府工作的重中之重。【原文：Inflation in Argentina slowed more than expected last month to its lowest level in three years, buoying an already ebullient President Javier Milei who made getting inflation back under control a key priority for his government.】

item.title: 欧洲央行卡扎克斯称基础方案是逐步降低利率
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马丁斯-卡扎克认为，欧洲中央银行应继续逐步降低利率。【原文：The European Central Bank should go on cutting interest rates gradually, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.】

item.title: 否认'通货紧缩'者的错误之处
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. item.title: 法官裁定：剥夺 Byju 美国分部的教育应用程序是错误的
item.description: 联邦法官周二裁定，陷入困境的拜聚公司软件帝国中的两款赚钱的教育应用程序被错误地从美国贷方手中转走，必须归还给受法院监督的破产托管人。【原文：Two money-making education apps that are part of the troubled Byju’s software empire were wrongly transferred away from US lenders and must be returned to a court-supervised bankruptcy trustee, a federal judge ruled Tuesday.】

item.title: 法国银行预测今年最后几个月经济零增长
item.description: 法国银行预计第四季度经济将停滞不前，此前三个月的增长受到巴黎奥运会的推动，而且政治局势继续增加商业的不确定性。【原文：The Bank of France expects the economy to stagnate in the fourth quarter after growth was boosted by the Paris Olympics in the previous three months and as the political situation continues to add to business uncertainty.】

item.title: 审查预算和人才需求，曼集团计划裁员
item.description: 全球最大的上市对冲基金公司 Man Group Plc 正计划进行一轮裁员，以审查其成本结构。【原文：Man Group Plc is planning a round of job cuts as the world’s biggest publicly traded hedge fund firm reviews its cost structure.】

item.title: 意大利准备淡化对加密货币交易征收 42% 税收的提议
item.description: 据知情人士透露，意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）的政府可能会批准一个联盟伙伴的提议，淡化酝酿中的加密货币交易增税。【原文：Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s government is likely to approve a coalition partner’s proposal to water down a mooted tax increase on crypto trades, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: Pimco 家乡一所年薪 54,000 美元的学校欲进军债券市场
item.description: 位于加利福尼亚州纽波特海滩的一所精英私立高中--债券基金公司太平洋投资管理公司（Pacific Investment Management Co.【原文：An elite private high school in Newport Beach, California, the home of bond-fund firm Pacific Investment Management Co., is making its own foray into the debt market.】

item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Scott Kleinman, co-president at Apollo Global Management Inc., has warned markets not to get too comfortable with the current trajectory of inflation and interest rates.】
